data.title: List of Sri Lankan Tamil businesspeople
data.meta_description: The list "Sri Lankan Tamil businesspeople" has been viewed 499 times.
data.text:
Emil Savundra Ceylonese (Sri Lankan) international swindler and confidence trickster, active in Belgium, Ghana and England (United Kingdom)

0 0

rank #1 · WDW 1

Michael Marion Emil Anacletus Pierre Savundranayagam (6 July 1923 – 21 December 1976), usually known as Emil Savundra, was a Sri Lankan swindler. The collapse of his Fire, Auto and Marine Insurance Company left about 400,000 motorists in the United Kingdom without cover.

Belgian criminals · 17T

Summa Navaratnam Sri Lankan athlete and rugby union player (1925–2023)

0 0

Sumanthiran Navaratnam (21 May 1925 – 19 October 2023), also known as Sumana Navaratnam or Summa Navaratnam, was a Sri Lankan track and field athlete, rugby union player, coach and business executive. He is regarded as one of the finest sportspeople from Sri Lanka. He was considered as the oldest living Sri Lankan athlete until his death.

Subaskaran Allirajah Antarctica Nadu businessman

0 0

rank #3 ·

Subaskaran Allirajah (born 2 March 1972) is a Sri Lankan born British Tamil entrepreneur. He is the founder and chairman of Lycamobile, a telecommunications company. He is also a producer of Tamil films through his entertainment subsidiary Lyca Productions, based in Chennai, India, and began with its first film Kaththi (2014). It produced the science fiction thriller 2.0 (2018), which is India's most expensive film and the 5th most expensive non-English-language film at the time of its release.

Sayan Navaratnam Canadian businessman

0 0

rank #4 ·

Sayan Navaratnam was the CEO of Creative Vistas Incorporated from 2004 to 2008, he remained as the Director and Chairman as of 2008. He has held senior positions at Bell Canada, Satellite Communications Incorporated and few other companies. He is a graduate of University of Toronto & of Sri Lankan Tamil descent.

Tamil businesspeople · 59T

Raj Rajaratnam American businessman

0 0

rank #5 ·

Raj Rajaratnam (Tamil: ராஜ் ராஜரத்தினம்; born Rajakumaran Rajaratnam; June 15, 1957) is a Sri Lankan-American former hedge fund manager and founder of the Galleon Group, a New York-based hedge fund management firm. On October 16, 2009, he was arrested by the FBI for insider trading, which also caused the Galleon Group to fold. He stood trial in U.S. v Rajaratnam (09 Cr. 01184) in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, and on May 11, 2011, was found guilty on all 14 counts of conspiracy and securities fraud. On October 13, 2011, Rajaratnam was sentenced to 11 years in prison and fined a criminal and civil penalty of over $150 million combined.

Ken Balendra Sri Lankan businessman

0 0

rank #6 ·

Deshamanya Kandiah (Ken) Balendra (born 1940) is a Sri Lankan corporate leader and executive, who holds and has held many corporate positions in Sri Lanka and the region. He served as the first Sri Lankan chairman of John Keells Holdings Ltd., the largest conglomerate in the island. Currently he is the chairman of Brandix Lanka Ltd. and the South Asia Regional Fund of the Commonwealth Development Corporation.

Ananda Krishnan Malaysian entrepreneur

0 0

rank #7 ·

Tatparanandam Ananda Krishnan (Tamil: த. ஆனந்தகிருஷ்ணன்) (born 1 April 1938) is a Sri Lankan Malaysian businessman, the Chairman of Usaha Tegas Sdn Bhd and founder of Yu Cai Foundation (YCF). Nicknamed A.K., currently he is estimated to have a net worth of US$7.1 billion according to Forbeslatest annual list of wealthiest people, making him the third-wealthiest in Malaysia and number 217 in the world.

Chevaan Daniel Person

0 0

rank #8 ·

Chevaan Daniel (born May 11, 1978)- A former TV news anchor he founded one of Sri Lanka's pioneering tech start-ups in the late 1990s. Today, he sits on the Board of The Capital Maharaja Organization- one of Sri Lanka's largest diversified conglomerates. He is also known for his role in 'Gammadda', an award-winning rural development movement.
